org.smpp.pdu.tlv

Class TLV

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smpp.SmppObject
      • org.smpp.pdu.ByteData
        • org.smpp.pdu.tlv.TLV
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TLVByte, TLVEmpty, TLVInt, TLVOctets, TLVShort, TLVString, TLVUByte

    public abstract class TLV
extends ByteData
    Base class for classes implementing representations of optional parameters of various types. Acronym TLV means Tag-Length-Value. Derived from ByteData this class "knows" how to parse from ByteBuffer and how to create a ByteBuffer from it's data. Descanedants of the class (concrete types) should rewrite setValueData and getValueData methods for setting and getting of the particular data type. The tag and the length is set and get by the TLV class. The class also provides additiona methods for checking various type validity.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    Logica Mobile Networks SMPP Open Source Team
    See Also:
    TLVByte, TLVEmpty, TLVInt, TLVOctets, TLVShort, TLVString

    • Method Detail

      • setValueData

        protected abstract void setValueData(ByteBuffer buffer)
                              throws TLVException
        Sets the data of the value carried by the TLV. Derived classes must override this method to provide their data related parsing of the value.
        Throws:
        TLVException - if the buffer contains somehow invalid data

      • getValueData

        protected abstract ByteBuffer getValueData()
                                    throws ValueNotSetException
        Returns the data of the value carried by the TLV as binary data. Derived classes must override this method to provide their data related creation of the buffer based on the value.
        Throws:
        ValueNotSetException - if the TLV wasn't set any data then there is nothing to be returned (the optional parameter isn't transmitted then.)

      • setTag

        public void setTag(short tag)
        Sets the tag of this TLV.

      • getTag

        public short getTag()
        Returns the tag of this TLV.

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
              throws ValueNotSetException
        Returns the length of the actual binary data representing the value carried by this TLV.
        Throws:
        ValueNotSetException - as this method uses getValueData for calculation of the length this exception can be thrown
        See Also:
        getValueData()

      • setData

        public void setData(ByteBuffer buffer)
             throws NotEnoughDataInByteBufferException,
                    TLVException
        Overwrites ByteData's setData and parses tag, length and the binary data value from the buffer. For parsing the data value calls abstract setValueData.
        Specified by:
        setData in class ByteData
        Parameters:
        buffer - the data which should contain binary representation of the class
        Throws:
        NotEnoughDataInByteBufferException - expected more data in the buffer
        TLVException
        See Also:
        ByteData.getData()

      • getData

        public ByteBuffer getData()
                   throws ValueNotSetException
        Returns the binary TLV created from tag, length and binary data value carried by this TLV.
        Specified by:
        getData in class ByteData
        Returns:
        the binary data buffer created from member variables
        Throws:
        ValueNotSetException - thrown from a TLV if the value was requested but never set
        See Also:
        ByteData.setData(ByteBuffer), TLV, ValueNotSetException

      • markValueSet

        protected void markValueSet()
        'Remembers' that the value was (somehow) set.

        public boolean hasValue()
        Returns if the value has been set.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Compares this TLV to another TLV. TLV are equal if their tags are equal.
